page.title: 11FARMING 2:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: These parishes are largely arable,but stock farming is also important.Bed- ingham farms include a dairy herd of 150 pedigree Friesians,a flock of 700 pedigree Suffolks & another of 300 on a smallholding;another carries a small herd of pedigree Herefords as well as riding horses.Hedenham has 2 intensive livestock units,1 poultry & the other- a recent,unwelcome addition -for pigs. The estate has a herd of 20 White Park cattle with an interesting history.In 1248 Baron de Ferrars of Chartley was allowed to enclose 1000a. of Needwood Forest & 25 cows & 1 bull were intro- duced there & left wild.In 1905 the Duke of Bedford bought them & then in 1970 the Earl Ferrars bought them back.Lord Ferrars is a member of the {Rare Breeds Survival Trust}so is happy to be able to conserve this rare breed so closely associated with his name.
